alert.note: Alert for Freeborn (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 7:53PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Freeborn County through 845 PM CDT... At 752 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Freeborn County, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Freeborn County, including the following locations... Myrtle, Manchester and Albert Lea Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 0 and 22. Interstate 90 between mile markers 144 and 173. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding, especially in the city of Albert Lea. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Minnesota.
